summary: Email correspondence from Justin Houston, a program manager at SigNet Technologies/Convergint Federal Solutions, confirming delivery of PTZ camera equipment to the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York in November 2018. The email includes tracking numbers and is a follow-up to an inquiry from a DOJ communication technician.

persons.name: Justin Houston
persons.role: Program Manager at SigNet Technologies/Convergint Federal Solutions
persons.context: Sender of the email confirming delivery of camera equipment to MCC New York and providing tracking numbers for shipments made in November 2018.

events.title: Delivery of camera equipment to MCC New York
events.description: Multiple shipments of PTZ cameras were delivered to the Metropolitan Correctional Center in New York, as confirmed by tracking numbers.

events.title: Additional camera equipment delivery
events.description: Another shipment of camera equipment was delivered to MCC New York.

events.title: Further camera equipment delivery
events.description: A final shipment of camera equipment was delivered to MCC New York.

locations: Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York, 150 Park Row, New York, NY 10007-1704
SigNet Technologies/Convergint Federal Solutions, 12300 Kiln Ct Suite E, Beltsville, MD 20705
keyFacts: The document confirms the delivery of surveillance camera equipment (PTZ cameras) to the Metropolitan Correctional Center (MCC) New York in November 2018.
Justin Houston, a program manager for a federal contractor, provided tracking numbers for multiple deliveries occurring on November 23, 26, and 29, 2018.
The email is a follow-up to an inquiry from a US Department of Justice communication technician at MCC New York regarding the delivery status of the equipment.
The correspondence occurred on October 7, 2019, which is after Jeffrey Epstein's death in custody at MCC New York in August 2019.
